title: Panchakarma Therapy
subtitle: Ayurvedic Detox & Rejuvenation
description: Panchakarma is a comprehensive Ayurvedic detox treatment that eliminates toxins, restores balance, and strengthens the immune system through a series of therapeutic procedures tailored to your dosha.

features.title: Detoxification
features.detail: Eliminates toxins from the body through natural purification methods.

features.title: Holistic Healing
features.detail: Addresses physical, mental, and emotional health for total well-being.

steps.title: Pre-Treatment Consultation
steps.description: Dosha analysis and body type assessment.

steps.title: Oleation & Sudation
steps.description: Internal and external oil treatments to mobilize toxins.

steps.title: Main Detox Procedures
steps.description: Vamana, Virechana, Basti, Nasya or Raktamokshana as needed.

steps.title: Post-Treatment Rejuvenation
steps.description: Diet, herbs, and lifestyle guidance for long-term benefits.

testimonials.name: Rahul Sharma
testimonials.feedback: Panchakarma was a life-changer! My energy levels are up, and my skin feels clearer.

testimonials.name: Aarti Mehta
testimonials.feedback: I feel deeply detoxed and more balanced emotionally.

faqs.question: How should I prepare for Panchakarma?
faqs.answer: We recommend a 3-5 day preparatory phase with light meals, avoiding processed foods, alcohol, and caffeine. You'll receive personalized dietary guidelines during your initial consultation.

faqs.question: Is Panchakarma safe for everyone?
faqs.answer: It is generally safe but requires evaluation by an Ayurvedic doctor.

faqs.question: How soon will I see results?
faqs.answer: Some benefits like improved digestion and sleep are often noticed within 3-5 days. Full results typically manifest 2-4 weeks after completing the program.

faqs.question: Is Panchakarma safe for everyone?
faqs.answer: It is generally safe but requires evaluation by an Ayurvedic doctor.

faqs.question: Can I go to work during the process?
faqs.answer: It is recommended to rest and avoid stress during the detox period.

cta.heading: Begin Your Healing Journey
cta.subheading: Book your Panchakarma therapy and experience holistic wellness

title: Abhyanga Massage
subtitle: Therapeutic Oil Massage
description: Abhyanga is a traditional Ayurvedic full-body massage using warm herbal oils tailored to your dosha. This deeply relaxing treatment nourishes tissues, improves circulation, and promotes detoxification.

features.title: Full-Body Relaxation
features.detail: Soothing strokes calm the nervous system and promote lymphatic drainage.

features.title: Custom Oils
features.detail: Oils selected based on dosha imbalance (Sesame, Coconut, Herbal blends).

steps.title: Dosha Assessment
steps.description: Therapist selects herbal oil blend as per your constitution.

steps.title: Warm Oil Application
steps.description: Oil is warmed and applied with rhythmic strokes.

steps.title: Full Body Massage
steps.description: Includes scalp and soles for full relaxation.

steps.title: Rest Period
steps.description: 10–15 minutes rest to allow deeper tissue absorption.

aftercare: Keep oil for 1–2 hours before showering
Drink warm water or herbal tea

testimonials.name: Neha Kapoor
testimonials.feedback: The Abhyanga massage melted away my work stress. My skin has never felt so nourished!

testimonials.name: Arjun Reddy
testimonials.feedback: Regular Abhyanga helped restore mobility after knee surgery. Amazing results!

faqs.question: Should I shower before or after?
faqs.answer: Shower before your session. After treatment, wait 1–2 hours before washing off the oil.

faqs.question: Can I eat before the session?
faqs.answer: Have a light meal 1–2 hours before. Avoid heavy foods.

cta.heading: Experience Deep Relaxation
cta.subheading: Book your therapeutic Abhyanga massage today

title: Siravedh (Venesection)
subtitle: Blood Purification Therapy
description: Siravedha, or venesection, involves puncturing veins to extract blood, primarily used for conditions involving blood stagnation or impurities, offering benefits like reducing inflammation, relieving pain, and improving circulation.

features.title: Blood Purification
features.detail: Removes impure blood to restore optimal circulation and tissue health.

features.title: Pitta Pacification
features.detail: Effectively cools aggravated Pitta dosha linked to blood disorders.

steps.title: Pulse Diagnosis
steps.description: Assessment of blood quality and dosha imbalance.

steps.title: Localization
steps.description: Identification of optimal vein site based on condition.

steps.title: Sterile Puncture
steps.description: Precise venesection with surgical-grade tools.

steps.title: Post-Procedure Care
steps.description: Application of herbal antiseptics and cooling compresses.

aftercare: Apply medicated ghee to puncture site
Consume cooling foods (e.g., coconut water, pomegranate)
No alcohol or spicy foods for 48 hours

testimonials.name: Vikram Patel
testimonials.feedback: My plantar fasciitis pain reduced by 80% after just one session!

testimonials.name: Neha Reddy
testimonials.feedback: Effective for my chronic migraines - fewer episodes now.

faqs.question: Is Siravedh painful?
faqs.answer: The procedure involves minimal discomfort, similar to a blood test. Herbal numbing agents may be used for sensitive patients.

faqs.question: How frequently can it be done?
faqs.answer: Typically 1-3 sessions per month, depending on the condition and individual constitution.

faqs.question: What's the extracted blood volume?
faqs.answer: Approximately 30-100ml per session, carefully monitored by the practitioner.

faqs.question: Are there dietary restrictions before treatment?
faqs.answer: Fast for 3 hours prior. Avoid fermented, sour, or spicy foods 24 hours before.

cta.heading: Purify Your Blood, Restore Vitality
cta.subheading: Book your Siravedh session with our Ayurvedic specialists

title: Shiroabhyanga
subtitle: Marma Point Head Massage for Vitality
description: An Ayurvedic head massage targeting vital marma points to regulate prana (vital energy), relieve stress, and nourish the scalp. Promotes relaxation, hair health, and mental clarity through rhythmic oil application and acupressure techniques.

features.title: Marma Therapy
features.detail: Stimulates energy points to restore pranic flow and release blocked emotions.

features.title: Hair Rejuvenation
features.detail: Uses herb-infused oils like Bhringraj or Amla to strengthen hair follicles.

steps.title: Dosha Analysis
steps.description: Therapist selects oil (e.g., coconut for Pitta, sesame for Vata) and pressure intensity.

steps.title: Warm Oil Application
steps.description: Herbal oil is gently massaged into scalp, neck, and shoulders.

steps.title: Marma Stimulation
steps.description: Circular pressure on key points like Adhipati (crown) and Sthapani (third eye).

steps.title: Steam Towel Wrap
steps.description: Optional warm towel wrap to enhance oil absorption (5 mins).

aftercare: Leave oil on scalp for 1-2 hours (or overnight) before washing
Drink warm water to flush toxins

testimonials.name: Neha Kapoor
testimonials.feedback: My chronic migraines reduced after just 3 sessions. Now I gift this to my overworked colleagues!

testimonials.name: Arjun Patel
testimonials.feedback: Noticed less hair fall and deeper sleep. Perfect lunch-break therapy.

faqs.question: How is this different from a salon head massage?
faqs.answer: Salon massages focus on relaxation; Shiroabhyanga uses Ayurvedic oils and marma science for therapeutic benefits.

faqs.question: Will my hair feel greasy afterward?
faqs.answer: Oil can be lightly rinsed with herbal powder (Arishtaka) if needed, but leaving it enhances benefits.

faqs.question: Can it help with hair regrowth?
faqs.answer: Yes, when combined with internal herbs and diet changes. Results visible in 8-12 weeks.

faqs.question: Is it painful?
faqs.answer: Pressure is adjusted to your comfort—should feel soothing, not painful.

title: Pada Abhyanga
subtitle: Grounding Foot Massage for Holistic Wellness
description: An Ayurvedic foot massage that stimulates vital marma points to promote grounding, improve circulation, and relieve tension. This therapy balances Vata dosha, detoxifies the body, and induces deep relaxation by connecting to the earth's energy.

features.title: Marma Activation
features.detail: Targets key points like Kshipra (heel) and Talahridaya (sole) to regulate organ function.

features.title: Detox Support
features.detail: Stimulates lymphatic drainage and kidney meridians to flush toxins.

steps.title: Warm Oil Application
steps.description: Herbal oils (e.g., sesame or mustard) are warmed and applied to feet/ankles.

steps.title: Marma Stimulation
steps.description: Therapist applies thumb pressure to key points for 2-3 minutes each.

steps.title: Rhythmic Massage
steps.description: Long strokes along meridians; knuckle kneading on soles.

steps.title: Steam Towel Wrap
steps.description: Optional warm towel wrap to lock in warmth (5 mins).

aftercare: Wear socks to retain heat post-massage
Dright Drink warm water with ginger to enhance detox
Practice grounding (walk barefoot on grass if possible)

testimonials.name: Deepika R.
testimonials.feedback: As a nurse, my feet ache daily. This massage feels like a reset button—I sleep like a baby afterward!

testimonials.name: Rohan M.
testimonials.feedback: Fixed my chronic cold feet in 3 sessions. Now my productivity spikes post-massage!

faqs.question: Can I walk afterward?
faqs.answer: Yes, but avoid strenuous activity. The oils may make floors slippery—wear provided grip socks.

faqs.question: Why sesame/mustard oil?
faqs.answer: Sesame balances Vata; mustard boosts circulation. Your therapist will choose based on your dosha.

faqs.question: Is it ticklish?
faqs.answer: Firm pressure is used—most clients adapt within minutes and find it deeply relaxing.

faqs.question: How often should I get this?
faqs.answer: Weekly for chronic issues, monthly for maintenance. Ideal with Abhyanga (full-body massage).

title: Udvartana
subtitle: Herbal Powder Massage for Detox & Slimming
description: A vigorous Ayurvedic massage using medicinal herbal powders/pastes to stimulate circulation, break down cellulite, and detoxify tissues. Ideal for weight management, skin rejuvenation, and metabolic disorders like diabetes. The rhythmic strokes exfoliate, nourish, and tone the body.

features.title: Lymphatic Activation
features.detail: Herbal powders like Triphala or Guggul boost lymphatic drainage to flush toxins.

features.title: Fat Metabolism
features.detail: Deep friction techniques break down adipocytes (fat cells) for natural slimming.

steps.title: Herbal Prep
steps.description: Powder blend (e.g., chickpea flour + Trikatu) mixed with oils/buttermilk based on dosha.

steps.title: Upward Strokes
steps.description: Therapist massages toward the heart to align with lymphatic flow.

steps.title: Targeted Areas
steps.description: Focus on thighs, abdomen, and arms for cellulite/fat reduction.

steps.title: Steam Therapy
steps.description: Optional herbal steam (Swedana) to open pores and enhance detox (10 mins).

testimonials.name: Ananya K.
testimonials.feedback: Lost 3 inches off my waist in 6 sessions! My skin feels firmer and glowing.

testimonials.name: Rajiv B.
testimonials.feedback: As a diabetic, my numbness reduced significantly. Now a weekly ritual!

faqs.question: Is it painful?
faqs.answer: Firm pressure is used, but therapists adjust for comfort. Feels like deep exfoliation.

faqs.question: How soon to see weight loss?
faqs.answer: Visible inch loss in 4-6 sessions when combined with diet. Fat breakdown begins immediately.

faqs.question: Can I do this at home?
faqs.answer: DIY versions exist, but professional therapists target marma points for full benefits.

title: Netra Tarpana
subtitle: Ghee Eye Bath for Vision & Vitality
description: A specialized Ayurvedic therapy where medicated ghee is pooled around the eyes to nourish ocular tissues, relieve strain, and enhance vision. Ideal for digital eye fatigue, dryness, and degenerative conditions like cataracts. Revitalizes muscles, nerves, and tear ducts through deep lubrication.

features.title: Tissue Regeneration
features.detail: Medicated ghee (e.g., Triphala Ghrita) penetrates deep to repair corneal dryness.

features.title: Light Sensitivity Relief
features.detail: Soothes photophobia and reduces dependency on artificial tears.

steps.title: Eye Assessment
steps.description: Therapist examines for redness/dryness and selects ghee (plain or herb-infused).

steps.title: Dough Dam Creation
steps.description: A natural black gram dough ring is placed around eyes to hold ghee.

steps.title: Ghee Pooling
steps.description: Warm ghee is poured into the dam and retained for 15-20 minutes.

steps.title: Gentle Cleansing
steps.description: Ghee is drained; eyes are wiped with rosewater cotton pads.

aftercare: Wear sunglasses if stepping into sunlight
Apply cooled rosewater compress at home
Follow with Netra Basti (extended therapy) for chronic issues

testimonials.name: Meera S.
testimonials.feedback: As a programmer, my eye dryness vanished after 2 sessions. No more redness!

testimonials.name: Aditya R.
testimonials.feedback: My ophthalmologist noted improved lens clarity post 6-week Tarpana course.

faqs.question: Is it safe?
faqs.answer: Absolutely—ghee is sterile and non-irritating. Dough prevents leakage into eyes.

faqs.question: Can I wear contacts afterward?
faqs.answer: Wait 4-6 hours. The ghee residue may blur vision temporarily.

faqs.question: How often for chronic issues?
faqs.answer: Weekly for 1 month, then monthly. Cataract support requires 3+ months.

faqs.question: Why ghee instead of oils?
faqs.answer: Ghee’s molecular structure mimics tear film lipids, enhancing absorption.

title: Nasya Therapy
subtitle: Nasal Detox for Neurological & Sinus Health
description: An essential Panchakarma treatment involving the administration of medicated oils/herbal preparations through nasal passages to purify the central nervous system, relieve sinus congestion, and enhance Prana (life force). Effective for migraines, chronic allergies, and neurological conditions.

features.title: Neuro-Cleansing
features.detail: Oils like Anu Taila bypass the blood-brain barrier to detoxify neural pathways.

features.title: Sinus Decongestion
features.detail: Liquefies and expels Kapha toxins (mucus) via sneezing/drainage.

steps.title: Pre-Nasya Abhyanga
steps.description: Face/neck massage with warm oil to open channels (5 mins).

steps.title: Steam Inhalation
steps.description: Herbal steam (e.g., eucalyptus) to loosen mucus (3 mins).

steps.title: Oil Administration
steps.description: Therapist tilts head back; 2-5 drops per nostril of medicated oil.

steps.title: Post-Nasya Rest
steps.description: Lie still for 2 mins, then spit out oil/mucus residue.

aftercare: Sniff warm salt water if drainage continues

testimonials.name: Vikram J.
testimonials.feedback: 10+ years of sinusitis gone in 3 sessions. I breathe like a teenager again!

testimonials.name: Priya N.
testimonials.feedback: My neurologist was shocked when my migraine meds dosage halved after Nasya.

faqs.question: Will oil drain into my throat?
faqs.answer: Proper head positioning prevents this. You’ll only taste a hint of oil temporarily.

faqs.question: Is sneezing normal?
faqs.answer: Yes! It’s the body expelling toxins. 3-5 sneezes per nostril is ideal.

faqs.question: Can I do this at home?
faqs.answer: Basic Nasya with plain ghee is safe, but medicated oils require professional guidance.

faqs.question: Why mornings are ideal?
faqs.answer: Sinuses are most receptive during 6-10 AM (Kapha time in Ayurveda).

features.title: Bone Strengthening

steps.title: Ear Inspection

steps.title: Lobe Massage
steps.description: Gentle kneading with warm oil to relax auricular muscles.

faqs.question: Why does it help TMJ?

title: Leech Therapy
subtitle: Bio-Detoxification for Chronic Conditions
description: An ancient Ayurvedic blood purification technique where medicinal leeches are applied to strategic points to remove impure blood, reduce inflammation, and stimulate healing. Particularly effective for vascular disorders, autoimmune conditions, and stubborn wounds through bioactive enzymes.

features.title: Bio-Enzyme Infusion
features.detail: Leech saliva contains hirudin (anticoagulant) and hyaluronidase (anti-inflammatory) for targeted healing.

features.title: Microcirculation Boost
features.detail: Creates controlled micro-bleeding to oxygenate stagnant tissues and dissolve fibrotic deposits.

steps.title: Site Selection
steps.description: Therapist identifies venous congestion points or trigger areas (e.g., knees for OA, spine for spondylitis).

steps.title: Skin Preparation
steps.description: Area cleaned with herbal antiseptic; small incision made if needed for deep congestion.

steps.title: Leech Application
steps.description: Sterile medicinal leeches applied to extract impure blood (30-90 mins).

steps.title: Post-Extraction Care
steps.description: Leeches removed; wound dressed with turmeric/neem paste to prevent infection.

testimonials.name: Harish Patel
testimonials.feedback: After 2 sessions, my diabetic foot ulcer finally started healing after 6 months of antibiotics failed!

testimonials.name: Meena Desai
testimonials.feedback: My psoriasis coverage reduced by 70% in 4 weeks. Better than steroid creams!

faqs.question: Is it safe?
faqs.answer: We use lab-bred disease-free leeches. Single-use protocol eliminates infection risk.

faqs.question: Does it hurt?
faqs.answer: Minor pinch during attachment. Leech saliva contains natural anesthetics.

faqs.question: How many leeches per session?
faqs.answer: 2-8 depending on condition. Typically 4 for joints, 2 for ulcers.

faqs.question: When to repeat?
faqs.answer: Weekly for acute cases (ulcers), monthly for chronic (arthritis).

title: Local Basti
subtitle: Medicated Reservoir Therapy for Joint Health
description: A specialized Ayurvedic treatment where warm medicated oils/decoctions are pooled in a dough reservoir over affected joints to reduce inflammation, dissolve stiffness, and promote tissue regeneration. Combines deep heat penetration with herbal actives for musculoskeletal conditions.

features.title: Deep Penetration
features.detail: Herbal compounds like Dashamoola Kwatha penetrate synovial fluid to repair cartilage.

features.title: Heat Synergy

steps.title: Dough Reservoir Creation
steps.description: Black gram dough ring built around affected joint (e.g., knee or neck).

steps.title: Medicated Oil Pouring
steps.description: Warm herbal oil (e.g., Mahanarayana Taila) is pooled inside reservoir (15-20 mins).

steps.title: Therapeutic Abhyanga
steps.description: Joint-specific massage with medicated oils after reservoir removal (20 mins).

steps.title: Herbal Poultice Wrap

aftercare: Apply medicated oil daily at home

testimonials.name: Sunita R.

faqs.question: How many sessions are needed?

faqs.question: Is it messy?

faqs.question: Can I combine with other therapies?
